, head of Egypt's antiquities department. They climbed over walls, forced open doors and entered the museum's vast souvenir shop. "I'm glad that those people were idiots," Zahi Hawass told TIME. They looted the museum shop. Thank God they thought that the museum shop was the museum. The Egyptian Museum itself is extraordinary, the repository of many of the country's greatest ancient treasures, including those from Tutankhamun's tomb, which take up nearly half of the second floor. 3.45 pm: Afternoon, Josh Halliday here taking over from Matthew Weaver . This just in: Chancellor George Osborne has been defending Andy Coulson . " Andy Coulson did a good job as director of communications," he said. There was never any complaints about how he did that job- which is pretty unique when you look at the people who've done that job in the past.
